DataElement.preferredName: Normal Control Collection Date Less Definitive Surgical Procedure Date Day Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of the definitive surgical procedure to the date of normal sample procurement, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Normal Control Collection Date Subtract Definitive Surgical Procedure Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._Methodology that tests integrity in experiments by isolating variables as dictated by the scientific method in order to make a conclusion about such variables. In a controlled experiment, two virtually identical experiments are conducted, but the factor being tested is varied in only one of them. This serves to isolate any causal phenomena._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen._The act of removing a part from the whole._Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Normal Scientific Control Collection Date Subtraction Definitive Surgical Procedure Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:Methodology that tests integrity in experiments by isolating variables as dictated by the scientific method in order to make a conclusion about such variables. In a controlled experiment, two virtually identical experiments are conducted, but the factor being tested is varied in only one of them. This serves to isolate any causal phenomena.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Methodology that tests integrity in experiments by isolating variables as dictated by the scientific method in order to make a conclusion about such variables. In a controlled experiment, two virtually identical experiments are conducted, but the factor being tested is varied in only one of them. This serves to isolate any causal phenomena.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Cholangiocarcinoma Follow-Up form per request by K.Diconstanzo. mc 8/26/14 Versioned to remove OC Quailfier Tumor Tissue per request by Tara. mc 12/30/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of D
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Definitive Surgical Procedure to Normal Sample Procurement
